commitResults.messageBody:
Created new chatbot Mochi, added introduction message and buffer
using underscores 40 characters long

Mochi is able to accept input and repeat the input back to the user.
When user inputs "bye", the program terminates.

Also created constants HELLO_MESSAGE and BYE_MESSAGE.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to store and display inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Mochi takes in input and adds it to a list. If list is inputted,
displays all contents of the list. Created function printList to help
print out list.

Task class to represent each task.

Contains fields such as description, position and a completed boolean.

Contains methods such as markTask and unmarkTask. toString() is
overridden.
Task does not need to track position field. Hence, removed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add WrapMessage class with wrap method
commitResults.messageBody:
WrapMessage is a public class with one static method. The wrap method
returns a string being wrapped in the buffer.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit fields and name of functions in Task.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed description and completed to protected fields. Renamed markTask
and unmarkTask to mark and unmark respectively.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add indentation for buffer in WrapMessage.java
Add Mark and Unmark in Mochi.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Shifted tasks array and int tasksCount to private static fields to be
accessed by all functions.

Editted Hello and Bye messages.

Editted printList function to include buffer

Added markTask and unmarkTask functions, which call mark() and unmark()
in each task object, while wrapping the reply from MOCHI.

Ammended addTask function in Mochi.java to split tasks according to
taskType and description. Created ToDo task according to taskType.

Also ammended toPrint message

Ammended addTask function to include partioning for deadline tasks.
Similar to previous add ToDo logic commit

Event constructor only takes in the description. All details after
event. Then, it splits the details to get the from and to duration.

Similar to previous commit on adding Deadlines to Mochi.java.

Furthermore, splitting of input to get details like from and to duration
are handled in Event.java, instead of in the addTask function.

Deadlines constructor now only takes in the description (all text after
deadline). The details are then split to get the task description, and
the by field, within the Deadlines constructor.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add input and expected output for current features
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a list of input describing all the existing features as of
Level-5.
	- Welcome and bye messages
	- todo, deadline and event tasks
	- list function
	- mark and unmark functions

Instead of leaving the loop inside the main function, I placed it in a
seperate function for exception handling.

Created new custom exception to be used for all Mochi related errors.
Wraps message in WrapMessage.wrap buffer.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling for adding of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
The following constructors now throw MochiExceptions:
	- Todos.java
	- Deadlines.java
	- Event.java
	- Task.java

Mochi.java was also editted to throw MochiExceptions from the above
constructors. MochiExceptions are caught in main function, which then
terminates the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for mark and unmark in Mochi
commitResults.messageBody:
If mark or unmark receive a negative task number, or a number greater
than the current number of tasks, throw a MochiException with the
corresponding error message.
Changed to ArrayList<Task> to support future operations like deleteTask.

Added ability to delete a task. Furthermore, more error handling for
mark, unmark and delete have been added.

Created new custom exception to be used for all Mochi related errors.
Wraps message in WrapMessage.wrap buffer.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling for adding of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
The following constructors now throw MochiExceptions:
	- Todos.java
	- Deadlines.java
	- Event.java
	- Task.java

Mochi.java was also editted to throw MochiExceptions from the above
constructors. MochiExceptions are caught in main function, which then
terminates the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for mark and unmark in Mochi
commitResults.messageBody:
If mark or unmark receive a negative task number, or a number greater
than the current number of tasks, throw a MochiException with the
corresponding error message.
Changed to ArrayList<Task> to support future operations like deleteTask.

Added ability to delete a task. Furthermore, more error handling for
mark, unmark and delete have been added.

If wrong input is received, previously, Mochi will print the error
message and terminate the program. Now, Mochi will only print the error,
but will not terminate. User can continute inputting commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change Arraylist to list in Mochi.java

commitResults.messageBody:
When implementing storage, current tasks need to be saved in a concise
manner for easy parsing.

Hence, toSaveString() returns a string that can be easily parsed, which
is different from eac Task's toString() method.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add parsing and alternative constructor to Tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
String representations of tasks in storage need to be parsed.

Each task type needs to parse strings differently, as the strings
contain different parameters.

Hence, parsing has been implemented in all tasks, and alternative
constructors have been created to create the respective tasks using this
parsed information.

commitResults.messageTitle: Attempt to add storage to Mochi.java
commitResults.messageBody: Will be back to complete Storage after changing base code to more OOP

More OOP. Replaced ArrayList<Task> in Mochi.java to TaskList for
abstraction. Also changed initialisation of the chatbot into a
non-static object.

Mochi now reads tasks from data/tasks.txt file on startup, and saves
tasks after the following tasks:
	- mark task
	- unmark task
	- add task (todo, deadline, event)
	- delete task

commitResults.messageTitle: Change input and expected output for testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Testing now takes into account storage and existing tasks in
text-ui-test/data/tasks.txt

Created a new Parser class which contains functions for parsing.

Parser contains a static stringToLocalDateTime function which returns a
LocalDateTime object to be used in the Deadline class

stringToLocalDateTime takes in the strings in the format of:
	- "yyyy-mm-dd HHmm"
	- "yyyy/mm/dd HHmm"
	- "yyyy-mm-dd"
	- "yyyy/mm/dd"

If a time is not specified, the time is automatically set at 0000.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change type of by field in Deadline
commitResults.messageBody:
by field in Deadline has been changed from String to LocalDateTime.

Affected methods now call the Parser.stringToLocalDateTime function.

deadline's toString method has also been adjusted to display the
dateTime in the format "MMM dd yyyy HHmm"
Ammended test input, expected output, data/tasks.txt
Deadline Date and Time implemented.
